intro: Impatiens aadishankarii, commonly known as the Aadishankari Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
